Package sudoku

Class SudokuPuzzle

java.lang.Object
sudoku.SudokuPuzzle
public class SudokuPuzzle
extends java.lang.Object
SudokuPuzzle.java - Initializes a puzzle object as a 2-Dimensional array of values, with methods to check the game rules.
Version:
2/2/20
Author:
Ian Catania

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SudokuPuzzle()
    Constructor to instantiate both the int and Boolean 2D arrays.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addGuess​(int row, int col, int value)
    Initialize a box with value, sets orig at the location to false.
    void addInitial​(int row, int col, int value)
    Initialize a box with value, sets orig at the location to true.
    boolean checkPuzzle()
    Returns true if all rules are satisfied for the entire board.
    boolean[] getAllowedValues​(int row, int col)
    Returns to the user the list of allowed values for a specific box.
    int getValueIn​(int row, int col)
    Returns the value in the specified box.
    void initializePuzzle()
    Assigns hard-coded values to the 2D int array "board", to set up the game.
    boolean isFull()
    Checks to see if all boxes have been filled with an inputted number.
    void reset()
    Re-initializes the puzzle, resetting all values to the hard-coded beginning.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Prints the Sudoku board for the user to see.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Prints the Sudoku board for the user to see.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      result - the Sudoku board as a string.

    • addInitial

      public void addInitial​(int row, int col, int value)
      Initialize a box with value, sets orig at the location to true.
      Parameters:
      row - The row number for the box.
      col - The column number for the box.
      value - The initial value for the box.

    • addGuess

      public void addGuess​(int row, int col, int value)
      Initialize a box with value, sets orig at the location to false.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the box.
      col - The column of the box.
      value - The value of the box, user-inputted.

    • getValueIn

      public int getValueIn​(int row, int col)
      Returns the value in the specified box.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the box.
      col - The column of the box.
      Returns:
      board[row][col] - the value of board at the specific index.

    • getAllowedValues

      public boolean[] getAllowedValues​(int row, int col)
      Returns to the user the list of allowed values for a specific box.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the box.
      col - The column of the box.
      Returns:
      values - A 1D array checking true or false for each possible value.

    • checkPuzzle

      public boolean checkPuzzle()
      Returns true if all rules are satisfied for the entire board.
      Returns:
      True or false.

    • initializePuzzle

      public void initializePuzzle()
      Assigns hard-coded values to the 2D int array "board", to set up the game.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks to see if all boxes have been filled with an inputted number.
      Returns:
      True or false.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Re-initializes the puzzle, resetting all values to the hard-coded beginning.
